intro: Sisymbrium pinnatifidum subsp. zanonii, commonly known as the Zanon's bittercress, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, cruciform flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
